title: Describing the Values
text: To describe the values, $$x$$, included in the intervals shown, we would say, “x is a real number greater than or equal to $$1$$ and less than or equal to $$3$$, or a real number greater than 5.”
speech: To describe the values, , x , included in the intervals shown, we would say, “x is a real number greater than or equal to  1  and less than or equal to  3, , or a real number greater than 5.”

title: Translate to Math Notation
text: The above statement, translated into inequality notations, is $$1 \leq x \leq 3$$ or $$x>5$$.
speech: The above statement, translated into inequality notations, is  1 is less than or equal to x is less than or equal to 3  or  x, is greater than 5 .
